Posts.Content: Bless you for being there for your brother. You did the right thing.
Posts.Title: Did i do the right thing?

Posts.Content: Went on line and found lots of pictures to look at. The pictures were a lot worse looking than my chest. I now just look like a boy chest and where the nipple should be is a very fine scar. I have chosen not to do reconstruction. Again looked at a lot of pictures and researched options. I decided it was not worth all the surgeries and pain just to have to bumps up front. To me they don't look real and that kind of freaked me out. I am only 5 months out since my double mastectomy and usually don't even wear a bra with prosethesis. I am amazed at how many people don't even notice I have no boobs.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy is my only option

Posts.Content: It is caused from the chemo drying you out. The eyes then over compensate. Get some over the counter eye moisture drops.
Posts.Title: What do I expect after next treatments?

Posts.Content: It depends on what they are looking for I was told. I have a MUGA because we are doing measurements on my valves.
Posts.Title: echo better than muga scan

Posts.Content: I have Triple negative with invasive poorly differentiated ductal carcenoma. Have the chemo schedule set but have a question. Will be following up Tuesday before my first chemo with asking the Doc but don't have the patience to wait till then. : ) Did you have radiation treatment? I am trying to figure out a timeline. Right now I know I am doing 3 week X 4 cycles of Docetaxel And Bevacizumab by IV with Capecitabine bid. Then surgery. Thane finish up with 3 week X 4 of (A?C) doxorubicin/cyclophoshamide. They haven't said how much radiation. They keep saying I will be busy for the next year but will it really be all of 2010? Vicki
Posts.Title: Triple negative and radiation treatment

He told me it was something nasty but finally told me it was sweetvickid.  He said I like to think of myself as tough but this way everyone would know right off the bat that I was a sweetie.  Richard and I are still friends although we live miles apart and I still say he was the little brother I never wanted.

Posts.Content: Just remember the implants have to be replaced.  One plastic surgeon told me he presers every 5 years and another said in under 10 years.  I did not have reconstruction and when I want to dress up I wear my foobs otherwise I go barechested.  Again it is a personal choice.
Posts.Title: prosthesis versus implants

Posts.Content: I have chosen to have a bilaterial mastectomy instead of a single. My question is does that mean that I can't use a pressure cuff or have bld drawn from the noncancer side? I don't like the idea of getting stuck in the leg or foot.
Posts.Title: ? on bilaterial mastectomy

Posts.Content: Don't do anything until you talk to a lawyer. A friend of mine stayed with her husband until she finished all treatment on the advice of her lawyer. During that time they worked on getting everything ready and when she had finished treatment then she divorced the sob. She had all of her ducks in a row and came out quite nicely financially.
Posts.Title: Unsupportive husband

Posts.Content: I would advise you go see one. That is what mine turned out to be along with cording
Posts.Title: Pain in arm/wrist after mastsectomy

Posts.Content: First Mom fell a week ago Sunday and when they exrayed her they found Bone Mets on two of her ribs. Then Daddy collasped on her Thursday and had to be life flight to the hospital. We found out he had a TIA and that the arteries in his neck were blocked 95 and 90%. He has had the artery on the left side cleaned and in a couple of weeks they will need to go in and do the right side. He is out of the hospital but had to come home with a cath since he couldn't pee. We go today to see the uroligist. Bouncing over to the hospital took its toll on me. Took him home on Monday and then Tuesday I stayed in bed.
Posts.Title: First Mom then Dad

Posts.Content: It is a very good idea to have one normally if you are over the age of 50. Chemo drugs make your bones and teeth soft so it is a very good idea to have one after chemo.
Posts.Title: Muscle Girls... was a Bone Density Test recommended for You?

Posts.Content: Fire the surgeon. Don't understand why the oncologist has not set up the biopsy. Tell the primary Dr. that the percoet is not working and prescribe something different and don't take no for an answer.
Posts.Title: I'm another one that needs to vent

Posts.Content: Had a bilaterial mastectomy on the 26th. Recovery is going good. Path reports came back good, no lymph node involvement. Now to get through 10 more rounds of chemo.
